intro: Dipcadi longibracteatum, commonly known as the long-bract lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and has a bulbous underground stem, typical of many Amaryllidaceae species. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. The flowers bloom in late spring or early summer, making it a notable ornamental plant in gardens.
